definition: to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute

sentences.english: Accounting centralized assessing system is one of the common practice of accounting designating system.
sentences.chinese: 會計集中核算制是會計委派制的一種常用方式。

sentences.english: Rigorous air-cooler model Rigorous Air Cooler design and rating.
sentences.chinese: 嚴格空冷器設計和核算軟件。

sentences.english: The doubt of the profit etc. of the business was put out by the municipal assemblyman .
sentences.chinese: 從市議會議員關於事業的核算性等疑問被髮出了。

sentences.english: You have to account for that in long-term prepaid expenses.
sentences.chinese: 你應該在長期待攤費用中核算這個。

sentences.english: Some shortcuts may be achieved to the expense of check, built into the standard distribution procedure.
sentences.chinese: 有些簡化法是犧牲標準分配過程中的核算得到的。

sentences.english: To a large extent they rely on bad-faith accounting.
sentences.chinese: 大一點說，他們靠的是狡詐的核算。

sentences.english: In the second chapter, methods for the measurement of the output of non-market services are discussed.
sentences.chinese: 第二章集中介紹了非市場服務產出的核算方法。

sentences.english: The expenses are accounted for in the long-term prepaid expenses account.
sentences.chinese: 費用在長期待攤費用賬戶中核算。

sentences.english: Shall I amortize the long-term prepaid expenses?
sentences.chinese: 費用在長期待攤費用賬戶中核算。

sentences.english: Pay accounting, and the basis for the drafting of the annual performance salary increases.
sentences.chinese: 薪資的核算，並依據上年度績效草擬調薪幅度。

sentences.english: The schools shall adjust tuition fees.
sentences.chinese: 各校調整學雜費之核算指標。

definition: per book/as recorded in the accounts
sum (result of addition)/addition/total/to add up a number of items/to accumulate
final account/to calculate the final bill/fig. to draw up plans to deal with sth
to set aside/to make provision for (capital requirements)
to verify accounting records/also written 對帳|对帐[dui4 zhang4]
